API Reference¶

Pandas Wrapper: spindex.pandas¶

Module wrapping pandas DataFrames.

Functions¶

st_join(left, right[, how, op, include_measure]) Spatial joins for DataFrames.

Classes¶

spindex.pandas.GeoFrame(dframe) DataFrame class with a distinguish GIShapes class for geometries.

Core Data Providers: spindex.core.data_providers¶

Data containers for a spatially indexed collection of geometric shapes.

The module aim to be compatible with many type of data and to evaluate lazily as much as possible. For example, GIShapes data attribute can be any container implementing a subset of the Python mapping API. These can be dictionaries, pandas Series or pandas GeoSeries for example, but also an iterator on these types.

Classes¶

BaseShapes Base algorithms on indexed shapes.
GIShapes(data[, itree, ecls]) In-memory container of spatially indexed shapes.

Enclosing Geometries: spindex.core.enclosing_geometry¶

Enclosing geometry classes.

Spatial indexes are built using simplifications of geometrical shapes. The simplified geometries are shapes enclosing the given geometry.

Classically, axis-aligned minimum bounding boxes (AAMBR) are used as a representation. This choice is in our opinion mainly due to its simplicity. Equally simple from the point of vue of both computational and memory efficiency is the smallest bounding sphere (SBS). The latter exhibit a few advantages over AAMBR, and is also implemented in this module.

Classes¶

Enclosing_Geometry Abstract interface for an enclosing representation of a geometric shape.
Rect(*args[, buf]) Axis-aligned minimum bounding rectangle.
Sphere(*args[, buf]) Smallest bounding sphere.

Spatial Indexation: spindex.core.spatial_index¶

Spatial Index data structure and algorithms.

The base data structure is the class IndexTree. Different algorithms for building such a tree are provided via subclasses of IndexTree.

Classes¶

DKMeans(*args, **kwargs) Index based on Divisive Hierarchical Clustering via KMeans.
IndexTree([max_children, max_leaves]) Data structure of a spatial index tree.

Spatial Joins: spindex.core.spatial_joins¶

Spatial joins using indexing.

Functions¶

st_join(left, right[, how, op, n_jobs]) Spatial joins optimised with indexing on the right series.
